processcsv package

Submodules

processcsv.groupby_col module

processcsv.groupby_col.group_by_col_sum(base_dir: str, in_pathfilename: str, out_folder: str, filename: str, group_by: List[str])[source]

Sum a column which normally is ‘amount’ with predefined conditions, the conditions are normally values in one or more columns. :param base_dir: parent directory of the file :type base_dir: str :param in_pathfilename: the csv file to be group by, directory plus file name :type in_pathfilename: str :param out_folder: the processed csv file to be saved :type out_folder: str :param filename: the processed csv file name :type filename: str :param group_by: a list of columns as grouped by conditions :type group_by: List[str]

processcsv.lookupcsv module

processcsv.lookupcsv.dict_val(f, key_cols: str, val_col: str)[source]

Populate a new dictionary from a csv file with predefined columns

Parameters:

f (csv) – source csv file

:param key_cols:The columns selected for the new dictionary’s key :type key_cols: a tuple of str :param val_col: the column selected foe the new dictioary’s value :type val_col: could be anyt, mostly will be float :return: a dictionary with selected columns of key and value :rtype: dict

processcsv.lookupcsv.differs(f1: str, key_cols_1: List[str], val_col_1, f2, key_cols_2, val_col_2, f3, f4, f5)[source]
compare two csv files - file1 and file2, with selected columns.

write the items exist in both files to a csv file - f2, write the items exist in f1 not in f2 to f4, write the items exist in f2 not in f1 to f5

Parameters:

  • f1 (str) – a file - f1 to be compared

  • key_cols_1 (a list of string) – the column’s names which are selected to be compared

  • val_col_1 (could be numeric or any) – the value to be compared, mostly ‘amount’

:param f2:The file -f2 to compare to the above file - f1 :type f2: str :param key_cols_2: the column’s names which are selected to be compared :type key_cols_2: a list of string :param val_col_2: could be numeric or anythe value to be compared, mostly ‘amount’ :type val_col_2: could be numeric or any :param f3: the items exist in both files :type f3: str :param f4: the items in f1 not in f2 :type f4: str :param f5: the items in f2 not in f1 :type f5: str

processcsv.splitcsv module

processcsv.splitcsv.split_csv(in_file: str, split_folder, out_file_name)[source]

split a csv file by the first column, and write to a new folder and new file name which is the one of unique value of the first column

Parameters:

  • in_file (str) – the csv file to be split

  • split_folder (str) – directory to hold the splited file

  • out_file_name (str) – the file name to hold context of the csv file with same vaalue in first column

processcsv.unique_items module

processcsv.unique_items.unique_items(base_dir, in_pathfilename, out_folder, cols=None)[source]

Find unique items in a column in a csv file if column name(s) specified; if no column(s) specified, provide csv file with unique items for every column.
